lines.line: Hello there!
Mornin'.
Hey...you're an adventurer, right?
Yes I am!
Got any quests for me?
Yeah, I do, as a matter of fact!
I am a poor, dispossessed nobleman, forced by circumstance to lurk in the middle of nowhere, soliciting help from passers-by.
You see, my fiendish half-brother has seized my estates and forced me into exile.
The simple lemon farmers suffer under his tyrannous yoke, and only a brave adventurer can lift his iron boot from the neck of the poor.
To reclaim my lands I will need to have my family sword returned to me so that I may present it as proof of my rulership.
Will you help me find my family sword?
Yes! Your uncorroborated sob story has touched my heart. When do we set off?
You'll help! Wonderful!
But, alas, my half brother has a powerful ally, the mighty demon...
Err...
Err...Barrelor!
Barrelor?
That's what I said!
Barrelor is an awesome opponent, and to reclaim my family sword you will need to defeat him, for he guards it within the deadly Trapped Pit of Barrelor.
Of course, I fear no demon!
Atta !
When I am reinstated in my rightful place, I will not be a very wealthy man, as my half-brother has squandered my family fortune.
However, I will gladly give you every bent penny of what is left, and starve in the gutter with my many, many adorable children, if you say you will help me.
Nonsense! Keep the money! I will dispose of this evil half-brother of yours and leave you what little money is left to feed your family.
Wonderful! Just pick up your diversion and we'll leave!
What diversion?
Great, I'll take the cash in used coins please.
Er...
Look, I think I'll wait here for someone a little more... you know...
...heroic.
Not a chance, this sounds too dangerous.
No, I don't think I'll help you out this time.
Had any luck finding someone to slay the demon?
What?
Oh! Yes! The demon, with the oppression and stuff!
No, not yet. Why?
Because I came to offer to help.
That's the spirit!
However, I will gladly give you every bent penny of what is left, and starve in the gutter with my many adorable children if you say you will help me.
No reason. I was just in the area and I thought I would ask.
I see...
Arrr... 'Tis lookin' bleak...
Cap'n!
Good news Cap'n!
I found us a hero down by the docks!
Be they heroic, brave and true?
Aye! They also be gullible, tied up and unconscious!
They were willing to help out some random stranger with a good enough sob story, so I smacked them with a bottle and rowed them over.
Brilliant! The island's location will remain a secret!
Bring 'em here and wake 'em up.
We may make it through this yet...
Are ye alright, ?
Ohhhh... My head...
It feels like someone has smacked me one with a bottle...
Arr... Those devils gave ye a nasty knock when ye came to aid us.
But now yer here we'll run those evil brain-eatin' dogs off the island fer good!
What? What is going on here?
I can't seem to remember anything beyond chatting to a man at the docks.
Arr. Well, that would be Pete, one of my men.
He's been out lookin' fer heroes like yerself to aid us in our peril.
Okay... I'll buy that. It sounds like something I would do.
So where am I, and what is going on?
Yer on Braindeath Island!
Where it lies is a secret, because ye are standin' in the brewery of Cap'n Braindeath, purveyor of the most vitriolic alcoholic beverages in the world!
Wow!
I am the notorious alchemist Cap'n Braindeath, and this whole operation be my idea!
With my crew of sturdy, upright pirate brewers, we sail the seven seas, distributing cheap 'alcohol' to all and sundry.
Oooh!
These be dark times, though,. See, a week ago we awoke to find ourselves beseiged.
The lads and I have held them off so far, but 'tis only a matter of time before they sweep through the buildin' and put us all to the sword.
Who?
Them!
Are they...
...protesting?
Arr, ! That they are!
Day and night they seek to break our will with their chantin', and their singin' and their passive resistance!
So, what do you want me to do?
Well, me and the lads got our heads together and decided that if we can get their Cap'n drunk enough, perhaps they'll stop protestin'.
If that happens, we'll slip out the back and set up shop somewhere else.
Well, how can I help?
Well, first of all, we need someone to go out the front and grow us some Blindweed.
'Tis one of the ingredients of our 'rum'.
The only problem is that those rottin' fiends have torn up and destroyed all but one of the Blindweed Patches.
Here,. I'll give ye the seed you'll need fer growin' the herb. Help yerself to the gardenin' equipment in the basement.
I'll warn ye again that those devils are sat right on top of the patch.
Try hecklin' 'em from a distance. Those Swabs may talk a good fight, but if ye can put a scare in 'em they'll keep out of yer way!
So...
What exactly do you want me to do?
Arr, well I want ye to get outside and grow some Blindweed.
Best be careful, fer them pirates will skin ye alive if they catch ye.
And what happens if I lose the seed?
Then I'll have ye flogged, hung, slapped with a haddock and sent back out there to fight the zombie hordes with little more than harsh language!
Come back and see me when ye ain't loaded down with stuff, and I'll give ye another.
Arr... Here,. Just take this and get goin'!
Why do you talk like a pirate? Didn't you tell me you were an alchemist?
Arr, 'tis true.
However, 'tis also true that I stumbled across the basic recipe fer my most potent of brews in a terrible alchemical accident.
See, 'twas a dark and stormy night, and the wind was howlin' around the trees as I worked late into the night.
Steppin' too close to a candle with my flask in my hand, I was suddenly swept up in a terrible, yet potently alcoholic, explosion.
And?
Well', it seems the fumes from that first batch of me 'rum' did strange things to me brain.
I don't remember the exact words the healers used, but apparently the stuff burned out the tiny, specialised part of me brain that tells me not to talk like a pirate.
That... that... that sounds utterly impossible!
Arr! That be what I told them!
So what do you make here anyway?
'Rum', !
The finest, most potent, most flammable and most debilitatin' 'rum' in the whole of Gielinor!
Rum, eh?
No, 'rum'!
What's the difference?
Well, see, it's like this.
If we called the stuff we make 'rum' without makin' the little quote gestures every time, then the Cookin' Guild has promised to do entertaininly painful things to us with whisks.
See, technically -
And by that I mean technically according to the Disposal of Hazardous Waste Act and the Health and Safety Laws -
technically, what we're brewin' here is Artificially Produced Hyper Condensed Sweetened 'Rum' Flavour Distillate.
Riiiiiiiight...
So ye see, we just call it 'rum' because the real name be a bit of a mouthful.
Want a drop?
No thanks... I think I'll skip it for now.
What exactly do you want me to do with this?
Arr, well, I want ye to get outside and grow some Blindweed.
Best be careful, lad, fer them pirates will skin ye alive if they catch ye.
So... how are you holding up?
Very well.
You sure?
Oh Guthix, who am I kidding?
We're all gonna die!
Who are you?
You're one of THEM, aren't you!
O...kay...walking away now, smiling and not making eye contact.
Game over, man! Game over!
Errr...keep up the good work.
How do I know you're not one of them?
Well, I don't know... the way I'm breathing could give it away.
That means nothing! NOTHING!
Don't talk to me! If I play this right, I can sell you lot out and make it to the mainland!
No school today mother, my brain hurts real baaaad...
What?
I no sleep in many, many, many days.
Don't sneak up on me like that!
Don't you know there's a war on?
I didnt think this counted as a war.
That's because you're a landlubber!
I bet ye've never had to beat a dozen zombies to death with a blunt toothpick!
That's right. Have you?
No, I've spent most of my time in the toilet to be honest.
Very well, considering.
Considering what?
That I've been crawling into the corner to cry whenever nobody is looking.
Wow... I always thought pirates were tough...
Hello!
'Ello guv.
Why are you not helping out the others?
Well you see, guv, I've got these unshakable religious convictions.
And those are?
Well, it's like this, see. I used to do a bit of the old priestin' on the side.
You know, collectin' for repairs to the church roof, passing the collection plate, jumble sales, nicking the lead off the temple roof so they needed repairing again.
Real holy stuff, you know.
That doesn't sound all that holy to me.
Well, that's because you're not a man of the cloth are you?
You are, in fact, what we refer to in layman's terms as a punter.
But anyway, all that priestin' left me with an unshakable faith in three things.
The power of good over evil.
The true glory of the human spirit.
And that I ain't goin out there with those things runnin' around.
Excuse me, but...
Arr!
Is there any way you could...
ARRR!
Is there anyone else I could...
Arrrrrrrrrr!!!
Fiiine...
Arr! What be ye wantin?
I, err, came to...
I have come to tell you to leave.
Ye have?
Yes.
Hahahahahahahahahahahahaha!
Bwahahahahahahahahahahahaha!
Wheeze...wheeze...
Gadzooks, that be the funniest thing I've heard all day! Say it again!
Stop ! I'll shatter me ribs!
I've come to ask you what you want.
Whadda we want? 'Rum'! When do we want it? Now!
So...if I were to give you 'rum' you would leave?
Not really. If ye were to give us 'rum' we'd kill ye quickly, as opposed to over a few weeks.
Oh...
I've come to join your crew!
Err, I mean...
Arr! Shiver me mainbraces and make them landlubbers walk the scurvy plank, Cap'n! I've come to join yer cut- throat, bilge swillin' crew! Also, arr!
Are ye quite done, ?
Yes, for the time being anyway.
Well, ye'll be glad to know that after that little performance I'd be glad to have ye on me crew!
Huzzah!
Course, I'll have te kill ye first.
Don't ye worry,. After we take the island I'll have the boss haul yer body to the temple and...
Err, never mind.
Never mind what?
Ferget I said anything.
Arr! Tryin' ter get away eh? Well ye'll never sneak past me, I'm the best lookout this crew has ever seen!
Err...look...an astonishing...thing. There. Behind you.
Ye'll have te do better than that, landlubber!
Hey you!
Hey yerself, landlubber!
...so that you will know exactly what time it is due to the horrible pain in your earlobes!
That be the most intimidatin' thing I've ever heard! I'm not messin' with you!
Arr! Prepare to die!
...meaning you'll need a dozen Ogres and a team of highly skilled surgeons to remove them!
Hahahaha!
Yer goin ter die!
...so that all you will be able to hear from then on will be the rustling of the ants walking through them!
Yer brave, but stupid!
...and then I'll use a wrench to remove the handles, so you'll see it every time you cough!
Who? Me?
...and I'll grind up what's left, mix it with lemon juice and throw the whole lot into the ocean!
Yer a deadman, sez I!
...leading to the eventual, violent explosion of those organs!
Here! I have your Blindweed!
Splendid, ! Go shove it in the Intake Hopper upstairs.
We'll beat them zombies yet! Arr!
Captain... I grew some blindweed but then I lost it...
There there, lad. 'Tis all right.
Here, I've been savin' some fer an emergency.
Go shove that in the Intake Hopper, and try not ter lose this lot!
I want ye to go put yer Blindweed in the intake hopper, and to be sharp about it!
And what happens if I lose the Blindweed between here and the intake hopper?
Theoretically, of course, as it would be almost impossible for me to simply lose the stuff in the time it will take me.
Gah!
Yer nothin' better than a sea-slug wearin', lilly-legged, bandy-livered landlubber!
I've got a little put aside fer an emergency. Drop some of that junk yer carryin', and come see me to get it.
Here, I was savin' a little fer an emergency, so take this and shove it in the hopper before I bung ye in there and turn the handle!
You had some all the time?
Why was I risking my neck killing pirates to grow some if you had some all along?
Less talk, lad, haven't ye got a hopper to be fillin'?
Less talk, haven't ye got a hopper to be fillin'?
Well, that takes care of the Blindweed. What now?
Well, now ye've shoved the Blindweed into the mix, what we need is a bucket of stagnant water.
Where can I get some of that?
Ye won't have to go far, we have a pool of the stuff here!
Here in the brewery?
No, that would be a strange thing to have in a brewery!
It's up the mountain to the north.
Up a mountain?
Well, 'tis technically a volcano, but ye get the general idea.
And I assume the place is crawling with these zombies?
No, there be not a zombie in sight.
Oh, good!
All ye have to do is get past the keen-eyed lookout that's been spottin' my men when I send 'em.
I'll tell ye that it won't be easy!
When is it ever...
Don't ferget yer bucket!
To get off yer lazy behind and head out to the stagnant lake on top of the volcano.
Chop chop, lad.
Hey! What are you doing out there?
Nothing.
Well Cap'n Donnie said no livin' landlubbers were allowed out of the compound.
So get yerself back in here, or yer for it!
I want ye to go pour yer bucket into yonder hopper.
Take yer time, lad, we're only bein' besieged by zombies.
Err... Captain...
Aye, what is it, lad?
Well, on my way over to the hopper some big boy stole the bucket and ran away...
Well, 'tis a good job I saved a little, isn't it? Now get rid of something so I can give it to ye.
Give me strength!
If ye weren't so good at distractin' the zombies I'd skin ye alive!
Take this bucket and pour it into the hopper. If ye don't get it right this time I'll have yer guts fer garters!
So is that everything?
No, next ye'll need to go outside and catch five loads of Sluglings fer the brew.
What? Sluglings? That's disgusting!
Arr, that it be.
To a weak-stomached, knock-kneed landlubber...
Why Sluglings?
'Cos, they're one of our super-secret ingredients! Yer not too susceptible to mind control are ye ?
Why?
Because they have been known te, well, influence people every now and again.
I'm sure ye've got nothing te worry about!
They aren't related to those Seaslugs are they?
No, we just call them 'Sluglings' 'cos of a long and convoluted story involvin' a metal pipe and three dead seagulls.
Aye they're related! Tis a good job they'll starve if they tried te eat yer brains!
So what should I do with these Sluglings anyway?
Well, Ye shove them in the Pressure Barrel in the attic.
And then ye...
And then I...
Pressurise 'em.
Pressurise them?!
Just a little.
Look, we don't have all day, get movin'.
Ye'll be needin' a fishbowl in a big net to help ye catch them slimy little blighters.
Pity ye ain't got any free space to carry one.
Here. Ye'll need this to catch them.
What should I do with it?
Just dunk it in the water. I'm sure a clever like yerself will have no problem.
Oh, and if ye haul up some squiddy-looking things, don't hesitate to shove 'em in the barrel too.
They add a special, fishy texture to the drink.
I want ye to go outside and catch five sea creatures from the squid fishin' spot.
When ye've grabbed them, jam 'em in the barrel in the attic and pressurise 'em.
How am I suppost to catch these things?
Ye'll be needin' to use a fishbowl in a big net to snare these little devils.
And if I don't have one?
Why, I oughta...
Come see me when yer not so laden down. I've got another one fer ye if ye need it.
Here! Try not ter lose this one! These things don't grow on trees, ye know.
Gah! Get that slimy thing away from me!
The slugs are talking to me... They tell me to do bad things...
Gimme that!
Egad... what just happened?
What happened is ye were messin' about with Sluglings!
Don't ye have anything better to do?
How could I kill my sluggy brethern...?
Snap out of it, ! Yer in slug-shock!
What? Who?
Gah! Sorry about that.
No problem. Well, now ye have just one more ingredient to grab, and then we can get this 'rum' flowin!
Well, how far away will I have to go to grab it?
Not far at all,. Ye've just got to get it from the basement!
Great! What is it?
Hold yer horses, ! While ye was off gallivantin' with yer slimy aquatic playmates, the 'rum' achieved spiritual critical mass.
To put it in terms ye'll understand: the brewin' equipment is possessed.
Possessed!
Don't ye worry yerself about it! This happens all the time.
Well, to tell the truth, my lads are a little quicker off the mark, so it only happens occasionally.
Not that I'm criticisin' yer performance,.
Give the controls a couple of belts with this wrench.
One of the lads did a little priestin' on the side before he came here. Get him to bless it and ye'll do fine.
I want yeto go clear the Evil Spirit out of the brewin' controls. Use the wrench I gave ye, but get it blessed first.
Mumblemumblewhatwrenchmumble...
What were that?
I said, what if I've lost the wrench?
Arr, ye landlubber!
Calm down, remember yer ulcer...
Look, I've got another wrench, but ye don't have any free space fer it. Come back when ye do.
Arr! I'd get more work out of a minty flavoured brick!
If ye lose this one I'll have ye turned inside out, covered with spiders and turned rightside in so they'll eat ye alive!
Steady on!
You used to be a priest, right?
I didn't nick anything, guv. I've got twenty people who'll swear blind I was...
Never mind. I need some help with the spirit in the brewing equipment.
Well, I'll bless something for you if you need it, but just don't spread it around that I'm giving out freebies.
Trust me, guv, lots of people need help after coming into contact with the spirits we produce here.
Can you bless this wrench for me?
Nope.
Nope?
Nope. You don't strike me as being... devout, you know?
Come again?
Your holy aura, it's a little shoddy, if you catch my drift.
You need a Prayer level of 47.
Oh!
Well why didn't you just say so?
I might have had a bit of an overestimation problem guv. I'm sure it won't happen again.
I might well do. Remember, only the first one's free.
Dominoes Ad Nauseum, Romanes Eunt Domus.
Sorted.
Is that it?
Oh, you want the full package deal.
All right. Brace yourself.
Thanks!
No problem, guv. Good luck with your little problem.
You might find that little wrench worth hanging on to after you're done with the Spirit.
Really? I mean, it's holy and everything, but I don't think it looks all that useful.
Well, it may not look much, but you'll find that you might need a few less prayer potions if you have it in your pack, if you know what I mean.
Well, no. I don't know what you mean, but I'm sure I'll find out!
You mean more help? I've already blessed one wrench for you, that should be enough.
I want ye to go clear the Evil Spirit out of the brewin' controls. Use the wrench I gave ye, but get it blessed first.
I see ye've got the wrench good and blessed, so go whack the controls till the Evil Spirit pops out.
I see ye've got the wrench good and blessed, so go whack the hopper 'til the Evil Spirit pops out.
Well, now that ye've got that spirit out of there ye can dump in the final ingredient.
And that is?
We need the body of a diseased Fever Spider!
Remind me never to drink anything you have ever made. Or touched.
When yer quite done flappin' yer lips, go down into the basement and whack spiders until ye find a fever spider body.
Shove it in the hopper, and then we're in business.
Ye may want to hop back to the mainland and see a Slayer Master.
These Fever Spiders carry a nasty disease, and ye'll need a pair of Slayer Gloves on to not catch it!
I see yer already wearin' some Slayer Gloves. That'll keep the Fever Spiders from gnawin' yer hands off!
I want ye to go kill a Fever Spider and jam its body in the hopper.
Whenever yer ready,.
What are ye doin', ? I want ye to shove that in the hopper, not in me face!
Ye just can't get good help these days...
Well, I stuck your spider in the hopper, what now?
Now ye stand well back and watch the glory of brewin' at its best!
Aye ! Now get outside and feed that stuff to the pirates.
Try givin' it to the Captain, he's in charge. Get him bladdered and the rest will fall!
Ye'll need to use that bucket of yours. Most stuff can't stand bein' in contact with our 'rum' fer too long.
Took us a lot of dissolvin' to work that one out.
So, what did he say?
The Cap'n!
Oh! I haven't spoken to him yet!
Well, get a move on!
And don't ferget the 'rum'!
Be that the finest, most abrasive 'rum' I've ever smelled?
Yes! That it be!
Hand it over or I'll run ye through!
Arr.
Ye be a good, fer a filthy livin' landlubber.
So... I take it your boss will be pleased?
Arr, that he will. I'll tell...
Wait a minute...
Arr, ye tricky dog!
Ye tried to trick old Donnie!
Oh well, I guess I'll have to try again.
Arr, you tried to trick me, but i was too clever for ye!
Besides, Rabid Jack would have my hide if I told ye it were him that sent me!
I'm sure he would. Good job you caught me out, eh!
Aye! Now get ye gone, and don't return without more 'rum'!
Hey you! I can smell the 'rum' on ye!
If it isn't in my belly by the time I cout ter three, I'll have ye flogged!
Arrr...that hits the spot...
Not much that was coherent.
Who is Rabid Jack?
Rabid Jack!
THE Rabid Jack!
Egad...I haven't heard that name...
...before.
So, who is he?
Dunno.
Almost as if I aren't changing subjects, well done!
With those rottin' dogs legless they'll never keep fighting us now, so we've decided to stay here and keep the 'rum' flowin!
Thanks,. We'd never have managed without ye!

characters.name: 50% Luke
characters.description: Middle-aged male zombie pirate, gravelly British accent, aggressive and intimidating tone with dark humor. Half his body is missing, making him bitter and quick-tempered.

characters.name: Brewer
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, nervous and panicked tone. A brewery worker suffering from hysteria due to the zombie siege, speaking with anxious urgency and paranoid outbursts.

characters.name: Captain Braindeath
characters.description: Middle-aged male, strong pirate accent, authoritative and gruff tone. A former alchemist who speaks like a pirate due to a brain injury, pragmatic and commanding but weary from the siege.

characters.name: Captain Donnie
characters.description: Older male zombie pirate, raspy and slurred gravelly voice, menacing yet drunken tone. An undead captain pickled by rum, speaking with dark humor and threatening undertones.

characters.name: Davey
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Cockney British accent, sardonic and witty tone. A former priest turned pirate with dubious morals, lighthearted and self-aware about his questionable past.

characters.name: Pirate Pete
characters.description: Adult male, gruff pirate accent, shifty and cunning tone. A deceptive scoundrel who tricks adventurers with fake sob stories, smooth-talking but ultimately untrustworthy.

characters.name: Zombie protester
characters.description: Adult male zombie, gravelly undead voice, aggressive and confrontational tone. An undead pirate protester who speaks in slurred, angry outbursts demanding rum.

characters.name: Zombie swab
characters.description: Adult male zombie pirate, rough gravelly voice, boastful and threatening tone. An undead deckhand full of bravado who talks a good fight but can be intimidated.
